instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [solved]820-3115 Battery indicator connector
threads.message:
Got a 820-3115 today that would not charge or run of the battery. The board was water damaged around the battery-indicator connector. Removed the connector and replaced the components around.
The board now runs fine and the battery is charging. My problem now is, where do I get hold of a new battery-indicator connector?

threads.title: [solved]820-3115 Battery indicator connector
threads.message: I need the other end to be soldered to the motherboard.

threads.title: [solved]820-3115 Battery indicator connector
threads.message: Take it from a donor board, in order to remove the connector use a lot of flux and apply heat with hot air at max from the back of the connector....

threads.title: [solved]820-3115 Battery indicator connector
threads.message:
There we go:
[URL="http://es.aliexpress.com/store/product/2pcs-original-new-logic-board-touch-screen-digitizer-fpc-connector-for-ipad-mini-2-20-PINS/631650_32285571103.html"]http://es.aliexpress.com/store/produ...285571103.html[/URL]
it seems to be the same one or as aprendiz said you can get them from a donor board

Edit: No it is not sorry, we are close :)

Edit 2: Nothing mate the connector is made by japanese company called SMK but I have not found nothing else.
People use to use flux + quick alloy for this type of connectors they solder and they remove it at 170C max

[URL="http://uk.farnell.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/Search?sf=&catalogId=15001&showResults=true&mf=101330&categoryId=700000006479&langId=44&storeId=10151"]http://uk.farnell.com/webapp/wcs/sto...&storeId=10151[/URL]

threads.title: [solved]820-3115 Battery indicator connector
threads.message: Ok, Ill try to remove from a donor board, thank you

threads.title: [solved]820-3115 Battery indicator connector
threads.message: Got one of another board, used an exacto knife instead of heat :)

threads.title: [solved]820-3115 Battery indicator connector
threads.message: I would love to see how this worked!

threads.title: [solved]820-3115 Battery indicator connector
threads.message:
What do you mean Louis? How I got it off with a knife or if I got it to work?
Well, it works now :)
